text: The 1942 Fort Riley Centaurs football team represented the Cavalry Replacement Training Center at Fort Riley, a United States Army installation located in North Central Kansas, during the 1942 college football season. The team compiled a 6–3 record, including a victory over Kansas State. Lt. Curry N. Vaughn was the team's head coach. Fort Riley also garnered attention in the fall of 1942 as the home base of boxer Joe Louis. ==Schedule== ==References== Fort Riley Category:Fort Riley Centaurs football Fort Riley Centaurs football
title: 1942 Fort Riley Centaurs football team
